comments:
Start RSE on Linux Redhat WS4-GTK (blank workspace).
Select the Local Files subsystem.
Right-click > New > Filter.
In the New Filter dialog, press the "Browse..." button.
Expand the "Local" node, then the "/" node.

The dialog shows "Expand failed. Try again."
The PDE Error log shows following exception:
va.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.rse.services.clientserver.NamePatternMatcher.<init>(NamePatternMatcher.java:176)
at org.eclipse.rse.services.clientserver.NamePatternMatcher.<init>(NamePatternMatcher.java:144)
at org.eclipse.rse.services.local.files.LocalFileService$LocalFileNameFilter.<init>(LocalFileService.java:128)
at org.eclipse.rse.services.local.files.LocalFileService.internalFetch(LocalFileService.java:578)
at org.eclipse.rse.services.files.AbstractFileService.getFolders(AbstractFileService.java:40)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.getFolders(FileServiceSubSystem.java:272)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.listFolders(FileServiceSubSystem.java:375)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.listFolders(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:848)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveOneFilterString(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:800)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveFilterString(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:741)
at org.eclipse.rse.core.subsystems.SubSystem.resolveFilterString(SubSystem.java:2258)
at org.eclipse.rse.files.ui.view.SystemViewRemoteFileAdapter.internalGetChildren(SystemViewRemoteFileAdapter.java:719)
at org.eclipse.rse.files.ui.view.SystemViewRemoteFileAdapter.getChildren(SystemViewRemoteFileAdapter.java:605)
at org.eclipse.rse.ui.operations.SystemFetchOperation.execute(SystemFetchOperation.java:175)

at org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:207)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Saw the same problem on Windows --> Setting Platform to "All"
On Windows, the NPE occurs when trying to expand a drive e.g. I:\
Guess I forgot to change the resolution flag to fixed.
